job_tasks.phrase: build delightful features and products for our community, as well as the thousands of companies who trust HackerOne with their cybersecurity posture.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core activity of creating and delivering software products and features, which falls under traditional software development.

job_tasks.phrase: You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.
job_tasks.justification: Coaching junior engineers is considered a form of technical leadership and team development within an engineering context, aligning with category definitions.

job_tasks.phrase: You'll combine your technological expertise, domain knowledge, and an unquestionable dedication to business objectives as you intersect with the engineering organization.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions aligning technological expertise with business objectives and domain knowledge, which is the definition of Business Understanding & Strategy.

job_tasks.phrase: You identify and make systematic improvements to technical weaknesses you'll find in your squad's codebases, and in shared codebases across the company.
job_tasks.justification: This describes improving existing software codebases, a fundamental software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Your first 30 days will be focusing on getting to know our HackerOnies. You will join your new squad and being onboarded - get to learn the technology stack (Ruby on Rails + GraphQL + ReactJS + many more)
job_tasks.justification: While mentioning onboarding and learning, the core implication is integrating into the engineering team and understanding the technical stack for future development.

job_tasks.phrase: Within 60 days, you will have committed a bunch of code to our repositories and will start developing a knack for being a fast and effective software engineer on our codebase
job_tasks.justification: Directly refers to writing and submitting code, a core software development activity, and emphasizes software engineering efficiency.

job_tasks.phrase: Within 90 days, you will start getting ready to lead your first project as Software Engineer
job_tasks.justification: 'Lead your first project as Software Engineer' implies technical leadership and project management within a software engineering context.

job_tasks.phrase: you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication
job_tasks.justification: Interacting with other business functions to understand context and needs falls under Business Understanding & Strategy.

job_tasks.phrase: By that time you will be able to understand the business value of our products and features, and the needs of our customers
job_tasks.justification: Directly relates to understanding business value and customer needs.

job_tasks.phrase: And you are able to translate feature requests into simple, but robust engineering (or non-engineering) solutions
job_tasks.justification: Translating feature requests into engineering solutions is a core software development task.

soft_skills.phrase: You are a collaborative and effective software engineer and team member.
You will interact with CSM's, who are the voice of our customers.
You will guide and coach the more junior IC's.
you will have branched out and talked to Sales, Marketing and various other functions, and developed a good sense of cross-functional collaboration and communication

profile.rationale: The job advertisement exclusively details responsibilities related to building, improving, and integrating software features, collaborating with teams, and understanding business objectives. It mentions traditional web development technologies (Ruby on Rails, GraphQL, ReactJS) and does not include any tasks or technologies related to AI, Machine Learning, or Generative AI. This aligns perfectly with the definition of a 'Software Engineer' profile, which focuses solely on Macro-Category A tasks without any involvement in AI specialization.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the responsibilities and technologies involved. There is no ambiguity regarding the role's focus on traditional software engineering, and no mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward.
